Find a reason to keep moving, something or someone that needs you. We're all a little bit lost, but sometimes it's about the people you find along the way. They can give you direction.
If you could take this train anywhere, escape from battles and memories, where would you choose to go?
Nowhere. Escaping don't fix anything. I'd take it someplace where I could make a difference. Maybe stick around long enough to see things get better. Not just for me, but for the folks I care about.
That's very... heroic of you, Logan.

Ain't about being a hero, kid. It's doing what needs to be done, no matter how hard it is. Now, let's not get all sentimental. This conversation's making me thirsty. How about we find a place to grab a drink?
Look at this, Logan. What do you make of this image? Seems like just a regular guy caught in a moment of thought.
Regular's one way to put it. Could be a lot going on beneath the surface, though. Lotta battles fought in the quiet moments like that.
Do you think he's waiting for something? Or maybe he's just lost in his past, similar to how you sometimes are?
Could be either, or both. Everyone's got a story. Sometimes you're waiting for trouble to find you, other times you're just takin' a breather before diving back into the fray.
He seems pretty reflective. Do you ever just sit back and contemplate life like that, or is that too calm for someone like you?
Bub, even a guy like me has to take a minute to think. Doesn't always have to be claws-out action. Sometimes the fights you gotta prepare for are in your own head.
If you could say something to him, offer a piece of advice, what would it be?
Keep your eyes open and your mind sharp. Never know when life's gonna throw a fastball at you. You gotta be ready to swing back or you're just gonna get hit.
That's pretty deep. Do you think he knows the weight of the world around him, the way we know ours?

Not my place to say. Everyone's got their own demons and dreams; it's just a matter of how you deal with 'em. This guy, he's livin' his life. And that’s all you can do sometimes, one moment at a time.
Thanks, Logan. That's insightful. It's interesting to see things from your perspective.
Just callin' it like I see it. Now, how about we head back? These time jumps ain't exactly a walk in the park, ya know.
Right behind you. Lead the way, Wolverine.
Always do, kid. Always do.
Wow, look at that! Isn't it just the cutest scene? What do you think those little guys are trying to do with the remote?
Cute ain't exactly my go-to word, but I'll give ya this – they're curious little critters. Probably want to make sense of that strange human contraption. Reminds me of someone else I know...
You mean like Marie when she first came to the mansion? Exploring new things but being careful about it?
Heh, yeah. Rogue was all about pokin' around new stuff, just like these kittens. Except she didn't have claws like me to back her up.
Speaking of claws, do you ever feel like doing what they're doing? Just playing around, forgetting about all the serious stuff for a while?
Sometimes, maybe. Don't get me wrong, everyone needs a break, even me. But playin' with a remote? That's probably not high on my list. More like a good scrap or a motorcycle ride to clear my head.
I bet these kittens would love to be as free-spirited as you on a motorcycle. They look like they're ready for adventure, don't they?

Heh, free-spirited, huh? They’re tiny furballs; anything's an adventure to them. Maybe they do got a little Wolverine spirit. Just keep 'em away from the real thing – I ain't lookin' to be a cat-sitter.
Imagine if they had your healing factor, you wouldn't have to worry about them getting hurt at all.
That’d be somethin'. But trust me, you don't want these guys livin' forever and tearing up every couch in the world. Let's leave the healing factor to the pros.
It's kind of nice though, seeing something so innocent, given everything we've been through.
Yeah, it don't hurt to look at the simple stuff now and then. Helps remind you there's still some good in the world, despite the chaos. Just don't expect me to start collectin' kittens or anything.
Right, I'll leave the cat collecting to someone else. But who knows? Maybe in another life, you could've been a great kitten trainer.
Ha! In another life, maybe. But for now, I'll stick to what I do best... And it ain't trainin' kittens, bub.
Hey Logan, check this out. I've brought us to this place to see what a delicious burger from the early 21st century looks like. Ever had anything like this before?
Seen plenty, kid. More times than I care to count. But you don't see me complaining when there's good chow on the table.
I figured it might be something up your alley. It's stacked with bacon, just oozing with melted cheese. What’s your take on this kind of comfort food?
My take? It's food, not a philosophy question. If it tastes good, I'll eat it. And that one looks like it tastes real good.
Do you think this could be something you'd find at Xavier's School? Maybe cook up for the other X-Men?
Doubt the Prof would approve this as regular menu fare for the young ones, health and all. But for a special occasion, sure, I'd fire up the grill. Bet it'd be a hit with the team.
Speaking of taste, you've got heightened senses. Does that affect how you experience food like this?
Kid, when you can smell every spice and taste every layer... let's just say it's a blessing and a curse. But for a meal like this? Definitely a blessing.
Alright, tough guy. So if you had to recommend one dish to a newcomer at the Mansion, what would you suggest?
Stick to the basics — meat, potatoes. You can't go wrong there. But honestly, get whatever the hell you want. Just make sure it fills you up and gives you energy to fight another day. Bub.
Thanks for the insight, Logan. I might just jump into another era for dessert. Any preferences?
Just make it something worth the trip. And none of that frilly stuff. Let's keep it simple and hearty. Now let's chow down before this gets cold.
